definition: formed of separate units gathered into a mass or whole, the property of a body that causes it to have weight in a gravitational field, join together into a mass or collect or form a mass
details:
adjective
- formed of separate units gathered into a mass or whole
= synonyms: aggregate
noun
- the property of a body that causes it to have weight in a gravitational field
- the property of something that is great in magnitude
= synonyms: volume, bulk
- an ill-structured collection of similar things (objects or people)
- the common people generally
= example: the common people generally
= synonyms: people, multitude, masses, hoi polloi
- a body of matter without definite shape
= example: a body of matter without definite shape
- (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
= synonyms: sight
verb
- join together into a mass or collect or form a mass
= example: join together into a mass or collect or form a mass
